arch:property.oc:show_val: mudbrick wall beneath floor L78, difficult to tell whether it is wider to the south (actually extends for another row into L77) and whether mudbricks near pit L74 are related (possibly mudbrick slump), pseudomorph organic residue found with a floor that possibly runs beneath the wall. possibly another row of bricks to the south -- removed accidentally during excavation. evidence for a floor surface when removing extra fill (L91) around the wall (pseudomorphs), but no remains under the wall.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: possible floor surface (organic pseudomorphs) in L91 and L77, cut by pit L74 ?, small stone wall L92 and surface L90 also nearby
1 deep and 3 long (originally thought to be 8 long, dimensions thought to be bigger)
